algorithm_technique: Calculate the smallest number with all set bits by finding the bit length of n and creating a mask of that length.
problem_summary_simple: Find the smallest number greater than or equal to n that has only '1's in its binary representation.
problem_summary_technical: Determine the number of bits required for `n` (`n.bit_length()`). Construct a number with that many set bits using `(1 << bit_length) - 1`.
key_insights: A number with all set bits is of the form `2^k - 1`.
The smallest such number greater than or equal to `n` will have at least as many bits as `n`.
The `bit_length()` method efficiently gives us the number of bits needed for `n`.
